author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.

posts.content:
At the moment it's just an idea so bear with me on this.
I was thinking of trying to organise a line-up of Canterbury Pitt buses at a show this year in recognition of these fantastic UK based conversions. I have spoken to one of the organisers of VW Action, which is 29th, 30th and 31st August and can very probably get an area within the show and shine allocated. I've never organised anything like this before so I'm making it up as I go along but who would be interested in getting their Pitts out for the boys (and girls) on Saturday 30th August? Obviously I don't want to tell them I can get 10 buses and only 1 turns up. Looking for an expression of interest at the moment and firm up how many in the next couple of months.
Stockers, ratters, slammers and s****ers all welcome

Shalom, Lee.

Sounds good Lee.

My CP bus is mid restoration right now. I would like to say I would be up for it but I'm not sure if it'll be on the road by then. Would be good to see a line-up, I hope you get some others on board.

Keep up the good work,
regards,
Chris

author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.

posts.content:
Aloha Chris!
Looks like a good excuse to set a deadline for the rest Be good to get another on board as take up has been a bit slow. Hopefully as the date gets nearer a few more will think about it.
If you PM me an address I will chuck a copy of an original sales brochure In the post for you so you can see all the different configurations of the seating.
All I ask in return is that you chuck a quid in the next help for heroes collection box you see

Shalom, Lee.

hi lee
yes would be interested in joining you,and fellow pitt buses at vw action,
mick
